Detailed Description

Data caching class.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

__construct ( $  strCacheSalt = '',
$  strCachePath = './cache/' 
)

More or less random string to be appended to a file name.

Constructor

Use $strCachePath to change the default folder.

Parameters:
[in]$strCacheSaltAdd salt for paranoid security.
Warning:
Hold your salt in a secrete jar.
Parameters:
[in]$strCachePathA path to the cache folder.

Member Function Documentation

pf_getCacheFileName ( $  strCacheName,
$  strCacheKey 
) [private]

Get a name of a file.

Parameters:
[in]$strCacheNameAn id of data to be cached
[in]$strCacheKeyCache key (e.g. might be page_id for caching page data)
Returns:
The name of the file with it's path
See also:
cCache::pf_writeToCache()
pf_readFromCache ( $  strCacheName,
$  strCacheKey 
)

Read data from cache.

Parameters:
[in]$strCacheNameAn id of data to be cached
[in]$strCacheKeyCache key (e.g. might be page_id for caching page data)
Returns:
$vCachedValued previously written with writeToCache or boolean false upon error (probably value was not saved)
Warning:
Always check returned value agains boolean false with `===`.
pf_writeToCache ( $  strCacheName,
$  strCacheKey,
$  vCacheMe 
)

Write data to cache.

Parameters:
[in]$strCacheNameAn id of data to be cached
[in]$strCacheKeyCache key (e.g. might be page_id for caching page data)
[in]$vCacheMe"any" data which in pratice means strings and ints simple arrays of both
Warning:
DO NOT cache boolean values! Map it to int if you need such.
Returns:
0 upon failure, 1 otherwise

Field Documentation

$strCacheSalt [private]

Realtive or absolute path to a folder that will contain cache Always contains '/' at the end.
